brief_summary.textblock:
Introduction: The life expectancy and the number of people hitting the old age have
      increased in recent years. The aging process is accompanied by morphological and functional
      changes that contribute to reduced functional capacity, increase the number of falls and the
      appearance of physical limitations. Exercise promotes maintenance of functional autonomy,
      improving the physical ability of the elderly making it more independent.

      Objective: To evaluate the effect of a program of muscle strengthening exercises associated
      with global stretching on balance, fear of falling and functional capacity in elderly women.

      Methods: This was a non-randomized controlled trial, in which 12 volunteers aged over 60
      years were divided into two groups: intervention group (IG, n = 7) submitted to muscle
      strengthening exercises and stretching, 2 times per week for 12 weeks, and the control group
      (CG, n = 5), not submitted to the protocol but were educated about physical exercises.
      Before and after the protocol were evaluated scores of Berg Balance Scale, the Falls
      Efficacy Scale International (FES-I) and Evaluation of Functional Autonomy Development Group
      for Latin American Maturity (GDLAM). Data were statistically analyzed within and between
      groups with a significance level of p <0.05.

clinical_study.brief_title: Muscle Strengthening Exercises and Global Stretching in Elderly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women aged over 60 years,

          -  independent in locomotion,

          -  with ability to understand verbal commands to perform the tests and participation in
             the treatment program

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  execution of other physical activities or doing other types of physical therapy,

          -  had any prior neurological deficit (stroke, traumatic brain injury, Parkinson's
             disease) or

          -  musculoskeletal diseases which compromising performance and mobility,

          -  use of orthosis for locomotion,

          -  inability to perform the evaluation tests and/or participation in the intervention
             session

intervention.description:
Each step of stretching on specific muscles was repeated three times by keeping the posture for 30 seconds, (Arnold and Kokkonen, 2007; Toraman A, Yildirim. 2010; Dai, Ware, Giuliani, 2012; Duque et al., 2013; Granacher et al., 2013). The Pectoral, Quadriceps, Paraspinal, Abdominal and Ischial tibial and sural triceps muscles were elongated.
Strength Training Muscle strengthening was performed using weights and dumbbells. The training load individually determined through the test of strength with 10 repetitions maximum. The load was reevaluated four weeks of training. The Abdominal, Paraspinal, Quadriceps and Posterior thigh muscles (hamstrings) were submitted to the intervention protocol.

facility.name: Laboratory of Kinesiotherapy and Manual Therapeutic Resources, Department of Physical Therapy, Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE)

clinical_study.official_title: MUSCLE STRENGTHENING EXERCISES AND GLOBAL STRETCHING: IMPACT ON BALANCE, FEAR OF FALLING AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY OF ELDERLY
